page.title: 15FARMING - Essendonbury Farm
page.content: {FARMING _ Essendonbury Farm Mr. Sinclair's family have been rent- ing the farm from the Salisbury Estate for over 100 years.He has a herd of eighty milking cows and he grows crops in the fields at the bottom of the hill {DAIRY FARMING The herd of Fresian cows are milked twice a day.He keeps twelve foster mothers to feed the calves.We saw twin calves and a spastic cow. {SHEEP He buys sheep in September and fattens them up to sell in the Spring. {CROPS} Many crops are sown in the winter or spring and harvested in August.{ {MACHINERY A horse hadn't been used for 35 years He has 6 tractors with many fittings and a combine harvester.
